pull.title: wallet_keypool_topup.py: Test for all keypool address types
pull.body: To protect against regressions if key scanning is changed.

events.message: wallet_keypool_topup.py: Test for all keypool address types

events.body: Tested that the returned addresses appear to be the expected type.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,32 +40,37 @@ def run_test(self):
         shutil.copyfile(wallet_path, wallet_backup_path)
         self.start_node(1, self.extra_args[1])
         connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 1)
+        connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 2)
+        connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 3)
 
-        self.log.info("Generate keys for wallet")
-        for _ in range(90):
-            addr_oldpool = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
-        for _ in range(20):
-            addr_extpool = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
+        for i, output_type in enumerate(["legacy" , "p2sh-segwit", "bech32"]):

@@ -40,32 +40,37 @@ def run_test(self):
         shutil.copyfile(wallet_path, wallet_backup_path)
         self.start_node(1, self.extra_args[1])
         connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 1)
+        connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 2)
+        connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 3)
 
-        self.log.info("Generate keys for wallet")
-        for _ in range(90):
-            addr_oldpool = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
-        for _ in range(20):
-            addr_extpool = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
+        for i, output_type in enumerate(["legacy" , "p2sh-segwit", "bech32"]):
 
-        self.log.info("Send funds to wallet")
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr_oldpool, 10)
-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr_extpool, 5)
-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-        sync_blocks(self.nodes)
+            self.log.info("Generate keys for wallet with address type: " + output_type)
comments.body: Make this logging lazy by using string format arguments :-)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,32 +40,37 @@ def run_test(self):
         shutil.copyfile(wallet_path, wallet_backup_path)
         self.start_node(1, self.extra_args[1])
         connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 1)
+        connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 2)
+        connect_nodes_bi(self.nodes, 0, 3)
 
-        self.log.info("Generate keys for wallet")
-        for _ in range(90):
-            addr_oldpool = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
-        for _ in range(20):
-            addr_extpool = self.nodes[1].getnewaddress()
+        for i, output_type in enumerate(["legacy" , "p2sh-segwit", "bech32"]):
 
-        self.log.info("Send funds to wallet")
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr_oldpool, 10)
-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-        self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(addr_extpool, 5)
-        self.nodes[0].generate(1)
-        sync_blocks(self.nodes)
+            self.log.info("Generate keys for wallet with address type: " + output_type)
+            idx = i+1
+            for _ in range(90):
+                addr_oldpool = self.nodes[idx].getnewaddress(output_type)
+            for _ in range(20):
+                addr_extpool = self.nodes[idx].getnewaddress(output_type)
comments.body: Why are you passing output_type to be the label of the new address?
